pageTitle: Three new Barclays Cycle Hire docking stations for SW London
description: Three new Barclays Cycle Hire docking stations to go live in south west London

breadcrumbs.title: Three new Barclays Cycle Hire docking stations for SW London

title.title: Three new Barclays Cycle Hire docking stations for SW London

texts: Three new Barclays Cycle Hire docking stations to go live in south west London

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["Three new docking stations in Clapham
            Junction, Battersea will make it easier to access Wandsworth and Clapham
            Commons","Transport for London is expanding
            Barclays Cycle Hire in Battersea."]}

From Monday
        28 July local residents and visitors to the area will be able to hop on the
        iconic blue bikes at three new sites near Northcote Road, Battersea Rise and
        Clapham Common.

The three new docking stations will
        be located at Clapham Common Northside, Abyssinia Close, and Limburg Road with
        a total of 78 docking points for Barclays Cycle Hire bikes across the three
        locations.

The new docking stations will add
        to the 19,000 docking points already spread across
        London where Londoners and visitors can use one of over 10,000 Barclays Cycle
        Hire bikes.

Barclays Cycle Hire is easy to use.
        Users can simply use a credit or debit card to hire a
        bike and from as little as £2 for 24 hours can make an unlimited number of
        journeys under 30 minutes each time. Regular users can register for annual
        membership which equates to 25p per day and get the same unlimited
        number of journeys under 30 minutes each without paying anything more.
         
        The bikes are ideal for short trips
        to the shops, meeting friends or as part of a daily commute.

They can also be
        used to explore the many parks, sights and attractions that London has to
        offer.

Nick Aldworth, General Manager for
        Barclays Cycle Hire at TfL, said: "Barclays Cycle Hire bikes are a great way to
        get around town and will be perfect for enjoying Wandsworth and Clapham Commons
        on a sunny day.  We are
        seeing record numbers of hires this summer and I am sure people in the area
        will find these three new docking stations a handy and fun addition to the
        other transport options available."

TfL has just published its latest
        self-guided cycling leisure routes map called "Explore
        London with Barclays Cycle Hire" which users can pick up at Tube stations and
        London Overground stations or at /modes/cycling/barclays-cycle-hire/leisure-routes . Popular routes include Quirky London, London's secret
        gardens, Saturday markets and Independent shops and markets.

To
        encourage more people to cycle in the capital, TfL regularly reviews
        opportunities for new sites for docking stations. Large parts of south and west London are now accessible by Barclays Cycle Hire after
        the area covered by the scheme expanded by more than 50 per cent in December
        2013.

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["The London Borough of Wandsworth partly
            funded the roll out of the scheme in the borough, which includes these three
            latest docking stations","Barclays Cycle Hire, which is already the
            second largest cycle hire system in Europe, has now seen 32 million journeys
            since its launch and remains an affordable and enjoyable way to travel around
            London","For more information visit www.tfl.gov.uk/barclayscyclehire","Images available on request."]}
